title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for x = 4

1 point is earned for relative maximum

1 point is earned for the justification

f'(x) = 0 at x = 4

f'(x) > 0 for 0 < x < 4

f'(x) < 0 for x > 4

Therefore f has a relative maximum at x = 4.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for x = 4

1 point is earned for relative maximum

1 point is earned for the justification

f'(x) = 0 at x = 4

f'(x) > 0 for 0 < x < 4

f'(x) < 0 for x > 4

Therefore f has a relative maximum at x = 4.

Therefore f has a relative maximum at x = 4.

Therefore f has a relative maximum at x = 4.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
2 points are earned for f''(x)

1 point is earned for answer with justification

f ″ (x)=− x −3 +(4−x)( −3 x −4 )          =− x −3 −12 x −4 +3 x −3          =2 x −4 (x−6)          = 2(x−6) x 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@7934@

f''(x) < 0 for 0 < x < 6

The graph of f is concave down on the interval 0 < x < 6.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for integral

1 point is earned for antiderivative

1 point is earned for the answer

f(x)=2+ ∫ 1 x ( 4 t −3 − t −2 ) dt        =2+ [ −2 t −2 + t −1 ] t=1 t=x        =3−2 x −2 + x −1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@703B@
